curam.util.common.message

Interface Message

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    CustomMessage, LocalizedMessage

    public interface Message
    An interface that defines the features common to all JDE-style messages. JDE-style messages can be localized or unlocalized, so a message string is not always stored. Messages can contain an array of string arguments that can be substituted for placeholders in the message string when the string is available after localization. A MessageLocalizer can be used to localize a message. A MessageBuilder can be used to substitute the arguments for the argument placeholders in the message after localization.

      static java.lang.String FATAL

      Informational message severity.

    • Method Detail

      • getMessageID

        int getMessageID()
        Gets the identifier of the message. For an unlocalized message, this must be non-zero and will be used as the externalized string reference used when the message is localized; for a localized message, it may be zero (meaning "unspecified").
        Returns:
        The message identifier.

      • getArguments

        java.lang.String[] getArguments()
        Gets the array of message arguments. If there are no arguments, an empty array will be returned. Elements in the array that are null will be treated as empty strings.
        Returns:
        The array of message arguments.

      • getZeroArgument

        java.lang.String getZeroArgument()
        Gets the special "zero" argument that exists separately from the array of message arguments. In most cases, this is unused, but it may be used for special message types where, for example, field labels are inserted after an exception is thrown.
        Returns:
        The optional "zero" argument.

      • setZeroArgument

        void setZeroArgument(java.lang.String zeroArgument)
        Sets the special "zero" argument that exists separately from the array of message arguments. The setter is provided on the interface because this property of a message may be set sometime after the message is created.
        Parameters:
        zeroArgument - The "zero" argument value.

      • getSeverity

        java.lang.String getSeverity()
        Gets the severity level of the message. This is equal to the value of one of the constants Message.FATAL, Message.ERROR, or Message.INFORMATIONAL. The default severity is Message.ERROR.
        Returns:
        The severity.

      • setSeverity

        void setSeverity(java.lang.String severity)
        Sets the severity level of the message. This is equal to the value of one of the constants Message.FATAL, Message.ERROR, or Message.INFORMATIONAL.
        Parameters:
        severity - The severity.
